title: Vissolis Discusses Solar Energy on 21st Century Television
text:
September 15, 2015 at 17:25 PM EDT Vissolis Discusses Solar Energy on 21st Century Television 
September 15, 2015 – Boca Raton, Florida – It is widely acknowledged that finding long-term renewable resources is crucial. Vissolis believes that they have found a solution that meets this need. 
Many companies are focused primarily on short-term energy production. There is a considerable pressure to avoid long-term investments, as many of the largest companies in the world are heavily invested in concentrated energy production, such as gas and coal. Tune in to watch the Vissolis segment airing on Bloomberg Worldwide as sponsored programming on September 20, 2015 at 2:30pm HKT. Check your local listings for airtimes. 
The Vice President of Programming for 21st Century Television, JL Haber, explained the significance of this guest by saying, “Renewable energy has become a global concern as people and industries try to find a balance between taking care of the planet while growing the economy. Vissolis has proven itself to be an important figure in the emerging solar energy market and we were eager to discuss their product capabilities with them on the show.” 
Solar energy has become increasingly competitive as a means of producing energy, even without subsidies. The solar energy can be used in up-and-coming economies to allow cities and governments to preserve the beauty of their area, produce the energy they need to build a thriving economy, and save money on energy costs. 
Vissolis develops and integrates solar electric generating systems. They help many commercial buildings connect with the desired solar power, often working between the 50 kilowatt and 10 megawatt commercial products. 
Renewable energy has become an important industry for the future. Those interested in learning more about Vissolis and their technology should watch this latest episode of 21st Century Television. Tune in to watch the Vissolis segment airing on Bloomberg Worldwide as sponsored programming on September 20, 2015 at 2:30pm HKT. Check your local listings for airtimes.
